QuestionText: If the 7th and 13th terms of an arithmetic progression are 34 and 64 respectively, what is the sum of the first 20 terms of the series?
A can do a piece of work in 15 days, B can do it in 20 days. They work together for 6 days, then B leaves. In how many more days will A complete the remaining work?
If sin θ + cos θ = 1/2, find sin θ × cos θ.
Two trains 150 m and 180 m long are running at 72 km/h and 54 km/h respectively. How long will the faster train take to completely overtake the slower train if they are moving in the same direction?
The ratio of number of boys to girls in a class is 5:4. If 10 more boys join the class, the ratio becomes 7:5. How many girls are there in the class?
The compound interest on a certain sum of money at 10% per annum for 2 years is Rs. 6300. Find the simple interest on the same sum at the same rate and for the same time.
A garrison has enough food for 90 days. After 10 days, 100 soldiers leave the garrison. The remaining food now lasts for 120 days. What was the initial number of soldiers?
In a class 60% of students passed in Physics and 55% passed in Chemistry. If 10% failed in both subjects and 200 students passed in both subjects, find the total number of students in the class.
Find the area of the largest triangle that can be inscribed in a semicircle of radius 14 cm, with the diameter as the base of the triangle.
